turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What's the matter?...Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Don't feel like nothing.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Get out of town, Bobby, as quick as you can.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Grace, I've been fucked over too many times, by too many women.  You're becoming the queen of hot and cold.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You'd never understand.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Try me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's just such a mess. With Jake I mean...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Nothing I understand better than a mess.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You mean the Shaman?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He <u>was</u> a Shaman...in the mine. We had nothin' after he died. Jake took us in, gave us a little money. He used to call me his "little halfbreed"... He kept Mom on the side y'know, cause he was married someplace else. He had kids in Phoenix I think, no one knew him around here...but the thing was...you see...  ...he was raping me the whole time...for years. He loved to do things to me. Believe it or not, he used to say he was in love with my ass. Y'ever been in love with a woman's ass?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You're sick too...he loved to do things to me. Control me. My Mom...it tore her up cause she couldn't do nothing about it. She become alcoholic...and the funny thing is-- I liked it. I liked being controlled by Jake. The truth was as far out and crazy as he got, I wanted <u>more</u>. I wanted to go all the way. Women say they don't want to be taken like, <u>really taken</u> -- that's bullshit -- they do. The first time he finished with me, he said I was a woman now. I was 14. Then he started crying like a baby...wanted me to hold him. It's a strange feeling to hate someone so much for so many years, but still want to hold him, comfort him... They found my Mom right down there  at the bottom of Apache Leap. She had cactus needles stuck all over her body and Virgil...Sheriff Potter said she was drunk and went insane. But I'll never believe she ran off that cliff by accident. She was born on this earth and she loved it. She was like me. She just wanted to fly away.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: After he got his divorce, he forced me to marry him...but when I saw her body, I swore to her on my soul that some day I'd get Jake for what he did to her...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah. What do you want. Life, right?  Have you ever been to California?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh yeah. It's far, it's another world.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is it pretty?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Oh yeah. It's beautiful, beautiful beaches. Blue water and clear skies as far as you can see.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Please. I won't hang on you. As soon as we get there you can dump me. I don't care. I just want to get out of here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Honey, baby, I <u>can't</u>. I can't even get out of here <u>myself</u>. Believe it or not, I need a lousy hundred and fifty bucks to get my car back from that crazy mechanic...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Darrell?  You know he and Jake are...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You don't have any money put away, do you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Jake never gives me more'n twenty bucks at a time, like a bird in a cage, he don't want me goin' anywhere...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: ...you could get me money. I'll get you out of here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Jake hides it. In a safe. In the floor. In the bedroom. He counts it. He loves to sit there and count it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: At night. He just sits there and laughs and talks to himself and counts it. I heard him. My Mom told me he had a hunnert thousand dollars down there. Maybe more.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: In <u>cash</u>?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Oh yeah. There's nothing else with Jake. He don't trust banks. He keeps the money in the floor right under the bed. He loves it so much, he wouldn't think of spending any of it on me. I never seen it but I know he's got more than a hunnert thousand at least...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: One-hundred-thousand!?  That son-of-a-bitch.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It takes a key.  He keeps it on himself all the time.  I mean <u>all the time</u>.  It scratches up against me when we do it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: If the key's on him, how do we get the key?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Kill him.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I can't kill, Grace. I can't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It's not like he's a young man, Bobby. He's had time to live. It'd be quick. I mean, he wouldn't even have to <u>feel</u> it...  I mean, sometime in the middle of the night, when it's quiet...when he's asleep, you could just come up behind him when he's pounding on me and...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I wanted to talk.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't think we have anything to talk about.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What about us?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: There is no us, remember?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Except I can't get you out of my head, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why?  Am I making you hot, or does the truth scare you?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Because I know you're full of shit.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I mean it, Grace.  I'm getting out of here, and I want to take you with me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I thought you couldn't get your car.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I could if I had Jake's money.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Is that what changed your mind?  The money?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't give a damn about the money.  I want you, and I want to get us out of this shithole.  There's only one way to do that.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Are you sure?...  About me, I mean?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I came back for you; this morning I came back.  Before I even knew about the money. You're what I want.  The only reason I stormed off is because you spooked me talking about Jake.  But I've had nothing but time to think about it.  It keeps coming back to you and me and us getting the hell out of here.  But we've got to get the money, baby.  We get the money, I get the car, then we get the hell out.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You said you couldn't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We don't have to kill him.  Just knock him out and tie him up 'till we get away.  It was your idea, remember?  I'm doing this for you.  I'm doing this so you can fly...fly like a bird.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Grace ... Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: After dark.  I'll leave the back door unlocked.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: The money's right here! Get the key!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No! You get it!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Bobby?  What the hell's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I ... nothing.  I just stubbed my toe on a rock.  Hurt like hell.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I got the money all packed.  I put the jeep and his caddy in the garage. People'll think maybe me and Jake went away.  Buy us some time...I know a back road we can take.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Good thinking.  What's all this?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I'm not coming back.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I can't see it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: It should be just up ahead.  Hold on ... there!  There it is!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Hey!  Take it easy.  Want to get us killed?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You don't know what it feels like to be free of that place.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't know about that?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You spent a day in Superior. I wasted my entire life there. I feel like someone just took a million pounds off my shoulders.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We've still got some dead weight to get rid of.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Can't we just dump him fast someplace?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I want a place where only the vultures will find him... It'll be over soon, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Then will you take me on your friends' boat with you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm not sailing his boat.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: But I thought --

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: We're going to buy a boat of our own baby, and sail it wherever we want to go.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Anywhere?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: What the hell? Why not? Where should we go?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Hawaii. I've read all about it. I've dreamed of going there and just lying on the beach while the water licked up against my feet. Oh, God. I'd kill to go there.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You already have.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You know I thought you'd left me back there.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Get real Bobby. He was gonna kill you <u>and</u> me.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He was in love with you Grace. He would've done what you wanted, you could've made a deal and ...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: The only deal he had in mind was killing you for Jake's murder and blackmailing me into sucking his dick for the rest of my life... no thanks.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He was a <u>cop</u>, Grace, they never stop looking for you when you kill a cop...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: He was a scumbag!... He wanted <u>me</u>, Bobby. These guys don't let go! Even when they're <u>dead</u>...  You don't know what it was like, Bobby. Those two, they were the same.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: So, aren't you going to ask me?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Ask you what? You mean what kind of horrifying sick shit is coming next?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't you want to know...? I bet it's burning a hole in your brain just now?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Let it go, baby. It's the past. I got a past...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't you really want to know? Was Jake my Daddy? Was I fucking my own Daddy? Don't you want to know that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: <u>I don't know why</u>!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No Grace, my hand's bothering me.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You think now that Jake's dead, there's all that money there and I don't need you anymore, and I might just sneak up behind you sometime and...pop!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't you think I would've done it if I wanted to? What can I do to make you relax, baby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You could give me my gun back.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I think nothing happens. You're dead meat. That's it.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You don't believe in anything do you, Bobby?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I believe in this moment, that's all. There is nothing else.  Come on. He must weigh 300 pounds.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Well, nothing. We dump Jake, we split the money, then you're on your own.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Don't leave me. I want to say with you, Bobby.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Why? So when the cops catch up with us you can sell me out again?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I was just baiting him! Bobby, I had to tell him that to get his guard down. Just like you told Jake you was going to kill me!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You lied to me all along! Lies, all lies. Your mother, your father, what story are you on now?  How come the town didn't know you was his daughter?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: When you're finished with me, I'm next! I been there, baby. I been there with other cunts...sorry, not anymore. I'll take you as far as California. If we can make that. After that you're on your own. Try Mexico. With all this bread, you can live like a queen.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I don't want to go to Mexico, Bobby! Please, I really want to be with you. Don't blow this. Don't you think I care about you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I think you're a lying, back-stabbing psycho bitch, and one day you'll kill me. But it's nice to know you cared...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Time to go for a walk, Jake.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: My mother died in this canyon.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Save the Mom routine, will ya Grace. It doesn't work with me. One, two, three...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Hope is a four-letter word.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: But we all need that too. Hold him.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Thank you. Thank you. I...I knew you wouldn't leave me, Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Bobby? Are you all right?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I busted my leg!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Can you make it back up?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Grace -- in the trunk of my car is a tow rope. It should reach down here. Go get it, throw it down.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: 'Cause I love you.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: And I love you too.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: And love's a funny thing.  Sometimes I don't know if I want to love you...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: <u>Jake</u>...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: He <u>can't</u> help you now, honey!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Morning, officer.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Son.  Little excitement out at the reservation this morning. Wayne and Dale Elkhart were up drinking all night and then Wayne starts chasing Dale around the desert with his shotgun. BIA handled it. I went by for backup.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Where ya goin'?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Harlin's.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Get in.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Seen you popping up a little bit of everywhere today.  You're not planning on staying are you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No, sir. I'm not going to be around long if that's what you're worried about.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: That's a nasty cut you got there.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, fell down and hit a rock. Not as bad as it looks.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: There was a young fellow over at Jamilla's today when it got hit.  Way she tells it he got whacked around good by one of the robbers.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sounds like it. I wish I could help Sheriff, but I just want to get my car and get on up the road.

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: That's a shame, Bobby.  A real shame.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: And that's not the half of it, Mr. Arkadin...

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: "Arkady"

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Right, Mr. Arkady. And that's not the half of it. I got your money, and I go into this little grocery store in this hicktown to get something to eat and then... well, it gets <u>robbed</u>!

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: ...And let me guess.  This robber -- he gets your money.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: No. Two of them. Two robbers. And they <u>both</u> get nailed... get shot by the old lady.

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: The old lady?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: With a <u>shotgun</u>!  She kills <u>both</u> of 'em, and... and the money in my bag gets all shredded to bloody pieces. Not one bill is left alive.  I mean, what are the odds?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Mr. Arkady, honest, I ad to beat it outta there before the cops showed. So now I don't have a cent to my name. I can't even get my car out of the garage.  I tell you, Mister...  if it weren't for bad luck I wouldn't have nay fuckin' luck at all, you know?   So, I was wondering if you could wire me a hundred fifty-dollars so I could get my car out of this garage, see?  The bus depot here has a Western Union thing.  And of course I'll pay it back with the rest of the money.

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: Which you don't have.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: But which I can get. No problem. Look, I can sell my car in Vegas. Blue book it's worth 16 at least. I just need the 150, uh...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Yeah, if you could send it care of...

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: ...Now, let me get this straight. Two years you give me problems with your fuckin' payoffs. Now you owe me thirteen-thousand dollars, you call me - collect - then ask me to wire you one-hundred-fifty dollars just so you can get your car fixed.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: A hundred-forty-five would probably cover it.

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: A hundred and ... Now you listen to me you deadbeat little punk:  I don't care if you got hit by a truck and run over by a steamroller.  You owe me thirteen-thousand dollars and <u>I want it</u>.  I don't care how you get it, or where from, but I want it on my desk tomorrow, or I'll show you what real bad luck is.

turns.speaker: MR. ARKADY
turns.text: What'd you say to me!

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Shit I'm sorry!...you can't believe the strain I'm under. I'm just under a lot of strain here.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I need a ticket.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Out of here.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: But, in particular?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I ... Mexico.  You got a bus that goes to Mexico?  That's where I have to go.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Mexico is a large country. Where in Mexico would you like--

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I don't care, just get me there.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: How about Ciudad Juarez? You could take a local, arrives in two hours, and transfer in Albuquerque. It'll get you across the border.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: One way, or round trip?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: One way.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: 30.55. Twenty more will get you back.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Twenty-seven, fifty.  That's all I got.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: The ticket is 30.55.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Keep your change.  Bus three-twenty-three. Leaves at seven fifty two, tonight.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'm sorry.  It's just ... you know ...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: You got a beer?

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: What kind?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Beck's.

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: No Beck's. A-1, Coors...

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Heineken?

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: No, we ain't got no Heineken.  We got Miller.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Genuine Draft?

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: No.  Just plain ol' Miller. Now you can fuckin' take it or you can fuckin' leave it.

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: I'll fuckin' take it. To go.

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: Shasta!  Now why'd you go and scare the nice man like that?  Sorry about that, mister.  Let's see, you want $3.25.  You try to have a nice day now, would you?

turns.speaker: BOBBY
turns.text: Sure, I'll try.

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: My lord, that little baby of yours Virgil, has gotten cuter'n a bunny's nose.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: What was that all about?

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: You know how that Toby is.  Thinks every man he sees is after his Jenny.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: More like Jenny is after every man she sees.

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: Let me get your change.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Flo, I'm just gonna help myself to a refill on the coffee.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: FLO
turns.text: Virgil!  Now look at what you done!  Are you all right?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I think I burned my gun hand!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Morning Grace.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Morning Sheriff. Got my drapes.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Well it's about time. Looks like you found yourself a helper too.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Well, he offered, and I just couldn't refuse. His car overheated.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Anybody hurt?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Hell, no. That Wayne can't shoot when he's sober, much less drunk. He's lucky he didn't kill his own danged self.  Well, anyhow, you stay cool. Nice meeting you, son.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You fuck this guy -- get him to do your dirty work and you think you can take the money and dump me?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No baby, you got it wrong.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: This road don't go to Globe, Grace -- where were you going to meet me?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I don't want the fuckin' money! I'm not gonna give up everything I got for a lousy 50,000 dollars. It's <u>you</u>. You <u>Grace</u> or nothing. The whole thing... I want you to be my wife.... What do you way Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You sound just like Jake... I did see into the future, Virgil, but you weren't in it. Go back to your family. They love you.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Goddamnit Virgil, stop!  Don't!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: ...But I bet the story she <u>didn't</u> tell you was the best story of all. How old crazy Jake <u>was really her Papa</u>. And she <u>liked</u> fucking Papa! And now she's killed the sonufabitch! Just like she's gonna kill you!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who was that on the phone?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Wrong number.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You spent a long time talking for a wrong number.  But then you make friends so easily.  Don't you, Grace?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I put up new drapes, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I know.  I was here when your apprentice was helping you.  Remember?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You never said anything.  About the drapes.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They look nice.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: You haven't even looked at them once.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They look nice.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: I picked them out for you, Jake.  I thought you would like the colors.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What the hell you looking at, girl?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Nothing, Jake.  Absolutely nothing.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ya little bitch, you like it don't you! You like it this way -- rough and hard. Gotta go fuck around on me, like your Mama, but you always gotta come home to Daddy, don't you, cause you know Daddy's the best.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yes, yes, hit me...beat me, please.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You been a bad girl, Grace. You took my heart from your Mama, didn't ya? You betrayed her! Like you did me. There ain't no forgivin' ya, girl!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Oh no! Oh please forgive me, Papa!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You broke her heart! You broke your Mama's heart. You stole me! That's right. Fuck it away. But it ain't ever goin' away, cause your Mama -- she's like a hungry ghost baby, she won't go away, she won't leave ya alone.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: No! No! Please!

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You didn't hear something?

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Yeah, I heard a key slapping against my ass.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: There's someone in the house.

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Jake, don't go out there. Call the sheriff.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Shhhh! Just like your Mama, always scared of things...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Help me, Grace, help...

turns.speaker: GRACE
turns.text: Like you helped her, Jake?

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I axed you a question.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Aw, Toby, we weren't doing nothing.  We was just talking.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You shut your mouth, girl, and get back over to our table.  Now, I'm not going to axe you again, Mister.  What were you doing with my girl?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Honest, Toby.  I just axed him for a quarter for the jukebox.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: Stay out of this, Jenny.  We got man's business to take care of. I ain't never taken no drugs, mister, and ...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I want to stay.

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: I said come on!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Toby!  Toby Tucker, leave him alone!

turns.speaker: TOBY
turns.text: You stay away, Jenny.  I aim to mess him up, and that ain't a thing for a woman to see.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Where's the fire sweetheart? Don't know how they work things in Nevada, but we got speed limits in this state.

turns.speaker: SERGEI
turns.text: Vat? I am going 5 miles an hour! I am looking town. I not even moving.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Whoa, what kind of accent you got there? You one of them Russians?

turns.speaker: SERGEI
turns.text: I am Russian, da! I am also <u>rich</u> Russian, da? Maybe we work something out, my friend Sheriff?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: What? You trying to bribe me, mister? Just cause you Russians ain't commies anymore, don't think money can buy everything...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: What's that?  ..."concealed" is a definite no no in this town, Ivan. You know anything about Jamilla's grocery store?

turns.speaker: SERGEI
turns.text: What fuckin grocery store, you fucking shithead idiot! You call yourself a police...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Get out of the car, spread them. You can jawbone all you want or you have the right to <u>shut the fuck up</u>! You commie motherfucker. Either way you're goin' to the can.

turns.speaker: SERGEI
turns.text: I want my lawyer!

turns.speaker: ANCIENT SECRETARY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Is Noel in?

turns.speaker: ANCIENT SECRETARY
turns.text: No sir he is not.  I read about you in the paper.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ANCIENT SECRETARY
turns.text: I was in an accident once too. A horse almost trampled me to death.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: ANCIENT SECRETARY
turns.text: I had to put him down.

turns.speaker: ANCIENT SECRETARY
turns.text: Proceed.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ask if he can check how many sick days I've taken since I've worked here?

turns.speaker: ANCIENT SECRETARY
turns.text: Is that the entire message?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
turns.text: Wrap it up.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: You've made a considerably wise decision.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: Once again please?

turns.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
turns.text: My son Jeb. It's a gift for him.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: How old is Jeb?

turns.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
turns.text: Four.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: No, no, no, no no... You need to go now.

turns.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
turns.text: What did I say?

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: Do you see any Telletubbies around here?... Do you see a slender plastic tag clipped to my shirt with my name printed on it?... Do you see a little Asian child with a blank expression sitting outside in a mechanical helicopter that shakes when you put a quarter in it?... No?... Well that's what you see at a toy store? Any you must think this is a toy store, cause you're in here shopping for an infant named Jeb. One of us has made a gross error and wasted the other person's valuable time...

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: I'm listening.

turns.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
turns.text: I'll keep it in my office room.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: What about Jeb?

turns.speaker: BUSINESS MAN
turns.text: I have a lock on the door.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't think I got the job in New York.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm still going to New York. Just not this second.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: I don't want to drag this out too long for Jeremy.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Is Jeremy okay?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: He's asleep.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: I don't know. It's been a while.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I haven't been sick this year. I know that.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Do you remember me getting sick?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Not a specific day. What's this about?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Megan, do you ever remember me getting sick?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: ...I can't remember.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's strange isn't it? Not remembering one fever... Or a cold... Or a sore throat. What do you think that means?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: It means we're probably to tired to remember.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Is that what you wanted to ask me?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Is there anything else you wanted to ask me while I'm up?... When was the last time you wore pink? When was the last time you drank soup standing up? Final call for strange questions at two in the morning.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No that's it.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: When was the last time I wore pink?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: The Mitchell barbecue three years ago.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh shit...

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Matching shirt and shorts. It was brutal.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: I've come to a decision.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Megan?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Yes. Is this David?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah? Megan where are you calling from?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: My name is Megan Inverso. We went to college together.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I remember you.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: I was hoping you would call me, but... Anyway I decided not to wait.  I was thinking, it might be nice to go to dinner together.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ...When you work with clients on machines, do they sometimes just jump up a level or two? Do something they didn't know they were capable of?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Not often, but it is possible. Most people get scared when they see the shadow of their limits. They don't know how long the shadow really is. They don't know how far away the real limits are standing... They stop out of fear.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What do I do when I'm around someone I know?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: You use your sleeve.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: He's just laying in bed. He's pretty upset. He won't talk.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: He's dealing with a lot of things.  I think he needs to find answers himself.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Would you like to try going--

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: out again?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Oh. Elijah Price came to visit me at the center today.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: He didn't do anything. He just told me his theory... It's sad when patients get like that. They loose reality.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jeremy what the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ...I think rust.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Rust?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: As a color, not as rust. You know, a rust colored paint or wood?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: I didn't know that. Mine's still brown.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: My turn. What's your favorite song?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Soft and Wet, by the Artist Formerly Known as Prince.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: We're supposed to be honest.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Soft and Wet. That's very interesting.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: My turn.  When was the first time the thought popped into your head that we might not make it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Think carefully?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What about the game?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: It's finished. I won.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Maybe it wasn't a specific moment, maybe it--

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I had a nightmare one night and I didn't wake you up so you could tell me it was okay.  I think that was the first time.  Does that count?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: That counts.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know Megan.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: It's like you resent us David. Resent the life you have.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: You've never been sick?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know for sure.  ...I don't think so.
